sections.heading: Repealed.Section 2-7C-3 - Repealed.Section 2-7C-4 - Repealed.Section 2-7C-5 - Repealed.Section 2-7C-6 - Repealed.Section 2-7C-7 to 2-7C-78 - Repealed.
sections.text:
Repeals.— Laws 2021 (2nd S.S.), ch. 6, § 79 repealed 2-7C-1 and 2-7C-2 NMSA 1978, effective March 17, 2022.

Sections 2-7C-1 to 2-7C-78 NMSA 1978, as enacted by Laws 1991 (1st S.S), Chapter 2, were held to be malapportioned and, therefore, unconstitutional in Jepson v. Vigil-Giron, D-0101-CV-2001-02177 (1st Dist. Ct., filed January 24, 2002).

Sections 2-7C-3 to 2-7C-6 NMSA 1978 were set out in full because they did not directly relate to the issue of district boundaries and were probably not meant to be affected by the court order.

sections.heading: Repealed.
sections.text:
History:Laws 1991 (1st S.S.), ch. 2, § 3; repealed by Laws 2021 (2nd S.S.), ch. 6, § 79.

Repeals.— Laws 2021 (2nd S.S.), ch. 6, § 79 repealed 2-7C-3 NMSA 1978, as enacted by Laws 1991 (1st S.S.), ch. 2, § 3, relating to membership, effective March 17, 2022. For provisions of former section,seethe 2021 NMSA 1978 onNMOneSource.com.

sections.heading: to 2-7C-78 - Repealed.
sections.text:
Repeals.— Laws 2021 (2nd S.S.), ch. 6, § 79 repealed 2-7C-7 to 2-7C-78 NMSA 1978, effective March 17, 2022.

Sections 2-7C-1 to 2-7C-78 NMSA 1978, as enacted by Laws 1991 (1st S.S), Chapter 2, were held to be malapportioned and, therefore, unconstitutional inJepson v. Vigil-Giron, D-0101-CV-2001-02177 (1st Dist. Ct., filed January 24, 2002).
